title: B Marshall Productions - Juneteenth
content: B Marshall Productions - Juneteenth Stop The Violence Pittsburgh HomeAbout UsStop The ViolenceBlack History MonthJubilee ParadeWPA JuneteenthA Soulful Taste of the BurghBlack Tie Honoree GalaUpcoming EventsFinancial Support Why We Commemorate Juneteenth- A call to Action FREE OUTDOORS FESTIVAL JOIN US ON JUNE 19-22 IN MELLON PARK, PITTSBURGH PA, FOR THE 2025 WPA JUNETEENTH HOMECOMING CELEBRATION. The WPA Juneteenth and Black Music Celebration is now the largest Juneteenth festival in North America creating millions of dollars, via tourism, for Pittsburgh and Allegheny County. See below. NEW SITE LOCATION The Pittsburgh Juneteenth Celebration has been held in Pittsburgh PA and at Point State Park since 2014, because of recent renovations to Downtown and at Point State Park, the WPA Juneteenth and Black Music Celebration has been temporarily moved to Mellon Spray Park for the 2025 Season. 2025 ACTIVITIES From June 19-22 the WPA Juneteenth and Black Music Celebration will feature FREE live entertainment from National Artist and Local Band, highlighted by RnB legendary groups Morris Day and The Time (June 19th), Dru Hill (June 20th) and Donnell Jones (June 21st) with other artists to be named for June 22nd. From 4pm to 10pm Daily. On THURSDAY June 19th, the celebration will include a BOAT-PARTY from 10:30pm - 1:30am on the Gateway Clipper Fleet (paid event). Tickets are now available through Eventbrite.com ______________________ On FRIDAY June 20th, Join us at Mellon Park for a FREE concert starring KUT KLOSE | JON B | DRU HILL ______________________ On SATURDAY June 21st, the celebration will continue it's annual JUNETEENTH MARCH & PARADE in Downtown Pittsburgh from 11am-1pm, celebrating Voting Rights and the end of Chattel Slavery in North America. The Celebration will also include it's annual Juneteenth YouthFEST at Mellon Park which involves various sporting tournaments (Baseball, Football and Basketball) and Youth-Fun-Zone activities for children from 9am to 4pm daily. The Celebration will also include healthy lifestyle programming with various activities for Seniors over the weekend. Eating habit talks, medical screenings and Exercise events. On Saturday June 21st, from 2pm-6pm at the Kelly Strayhorn Theater (East Liberty), the Celebration will include educational components with JUNETEENTH FREEDOM TALKS with renowned Anti-racist Scholar TIM WISE and Community Activist 19-KEYS. Limited space is available and this is a Free Community Event. Tickets available through Eventbrite.com. Get ready for another FREE concert starring THE BLACKBYRDS | HI-FIVE | DONNELL JONES at Mellon Park. ______________________ On Sunday June 22nd, the WPA Juneteenth and Black Music Celebration will conclude with a Gospel Presentation and other closeout activities at Mellon Park. SMALL BUSINESS ECONOMIC IMPACT ZONE The WPA Juneteenth and Black Music Celebration will host over 200 small business vendors inside it's Vendor Plaza to help various minority companies generate funds during this event from 11am to 10pm Daily. VENDORS | SPEAKERS | LIVE ENTERTAINMENT | PARADE | EDUCATION PROGRAM _________________ Our MissionOur SponsorsUpcoming Events2019201820172016201520142013News How to Find Us B Marshall Productions Phone: 724-205-9376 724-205-9376 Email: StoptheViolencePgh@yahoo.com Get Connected With Us. Like us on Facebook to learn about our latest art exhibitions and special admission offers! Share Recommend this page on: Print | Sitemap ¬© B Marshall Productions Login Web ViewMobile View Logout | Edit page

title: DOORS OPEN Pittsburgh
content: DOORS OPEN Pittsburgh 0 Skip to Content DONATE Open Menu Close Menu DONATE Open Menu Close Menu #BeNebbyWe invite you to celebrate Pittsburgh‚Äôs treasured architecture, our collective heritage, and our unique neighborhoods.We offer Neighborhood Events, Guided Walking Tours, Architectural Boat Tours and Insider Tours. FOLLOW US ON SOCIAL Our 2024 tours are wrapped for the season, but you can still enjoy our Virtual Storytelling series! Be sure to find out when our 2025 season kicks off by joining our mailing list. Neighborhood Events General Information Find out what you DON‚ÄôT know about Pittsburgh‚Äôs amazing neighborhoods with these self-guided events that give you behind-the-scenes access, and the opportunity to #BeNebby in a select neighborhood. Pricing Cost is $15-$20. Boat Tours General Information Experience the majesty of Pittsburgh‚Äôs skyline from our rivers. Get up-close and personal with our bridges. Learn about the historical significance of our rivers ‚Äì a constant contributor to the evolution of our City. Pricing Cost is $35-$45. Guided Walking Tours General Information Our experienced and passionate tour guides take you off-the-beaten path, steeping you in the history, cultural contributions, and little-known facts about celebrated Pittsburghers, craftsmen, and tycoons, along with beautiful architectural details. Pricing Cost is $20-$30. Insider Tours General Information Looking for a unique outing, date night, or a special occasion celebration? Join DOORS OPEN Pittsburgh for an Insider Tour‚Äìan exclusive experience in surprising places. Pricing Cost is $15-$25. Virtual Storytelling General Information All of our DOORS OPEN Pittsburgh Virtual Storytelling live events have been recorded and are available for on-demand playback through Patreon, our content host. Pricing $10 per month JOIN OUR MAILING LIST GET TO KNOW USDOORS OPEN Pittsburgh celebrates Pittsburgh‚Äôs unique architecture and history by providing historical tours inside iconic buildings.Our historical tours invite the public to go behind-the-scenes with us, hear lesser-known stories, or just simply explore these buildings as we peek into the treasured architecture that unfolds the history of Pittsburgh for you. WHAT WE BELIEVEWe believe that our buildings embody our ideas about style and taste. They document our most cutting-edge advancements in technology. They reflect our hopes, dreams, struggles, and perseverance of a city and its individual communities.It is our collective responsibility‚Äîas Pittsburghers‚Äîto protect and celebrate what the past has gifted to us. OUR MISSIONDOORS OPEN Pittsburgh encourages the appreciation of Pittsburgh‚Äôs architectural design, history, and art through a series of immersive events that educate the general public by sharing the quintessential stories of the city‚Äôs past, present, and future while allowing unprecedented access inside iconic buildings across its many culturally eclectic neighborhoods. Learn more #BeNebby Blog Welcome to the place where you can indulge your nebbiness about Pittsburgh‚Äôs unique history and neighborhoods. Interested in contributing to our #BeNebby Blog? Please email us! #BeNebby Blog Pittsburgh‚Äôs Public Staircases: A Unique Legacy in the Steel City‚Äôs Landscape Read More ‚Üí Celebrating the New Year in Pittsburgh Read More ‚Üí The Horne's Christmas Tree: A Pittsburgh Holiday Tradition Read More ‚Üí The Three Sisters of Pittsburgh Read More ‚Üí Discover Pittsburgh no matter where you are with our Virtual Storytelling On-Demand catalog. Learn More #BeNebby Merchandise Wear your nebbiness proudly and support DOORS OPEN Pittsburgh by shopping for our unique #BeNebby t-shirts, sweatshirts, hats, masks, bags and more. Shop Now Lend a hand!Looking for a volunteer opportunity to share your enthusiasm about Pittsburgh?Wanting to connect with other service-minded people who want to support thriving neighborhoods in Pittsburgh?Want to learn more about all things Pittsburgh along with others who share your interest?Please join the DOORS OPEN volunteer team for 2023 ‚Äì our season will resume in April 2023. SIGN UP TO VOLUNTEER

title: America's Mile | The Nation's Signature One-Mile Race | Visit Pittsburgh
content: America's Mile | The Nation's Signature One-Mile Race | Visit Pittsburgh Skip to content Newsletter Discover Your Persona 77¬∞F 0 Saved Navigation Things to DoFree Things to DoFamily FunTours & SightseeingOutdoor AdventureArts & CultureShoppingHealth & WellnessPittsburgh Sports TeamsCasinos & GamingFilm FestivalsEvents & FestivalsSubmit Your EventThis Week in PittsburghAnnual EventsHoliday EventsHalloween EventsFilm FestivalsFood FestivalsMarathons, Runs & WalksHotels & ResortsRestaurants & CulinaryBars & NightlifePittsburgh Craft BreweriesWineries & DistilleriesFarms & Farmers MarketsPlan Your TripPittsburgh Insiders GuideDiscounts and PassesBeyond PittsburghTransportationExplore Black Culture & HeritageLGBTQIA+ Travel in PittsburghPet-friendly TravelCollege VisitsSenior TravelMedical TravelAccessibility GuideWeatherWelcome CentersNewsletterNeighborhoodsMeetings and EventsMeet in PittsburghHotelsEvent ServicesMarketing ToolkitGroup TourSubmit RFPContact UsShow Your BadgeSportsPITTSBURGHAbout SportsPITTSBURGHSports Event PlannerSports FacilitiesCalendar of EventsSports Event AttendeePower of Sports Economy Weddings & ReunionsMediaPartners Discover Your Persona America's Mile America's Mile Awaits... Join us for America's Mile, a spectacular race event open to all, set against Pittsburgh's breathtaking North Shore. Choose your challenge from diverse heats like the inclusive MOVE Mile, the brave Heroes' Mile, and the competitive Aspire Mile (just to name a few of your options!), catering to every age and ability.Register, train, and then take to the start line on July 12, 2024, to create your moment in this national celebration. Cross the finish line and keep the energy high at the Mile 1.1 post-race party. Ready to write your story? America's Mile awaits. When & Where America's Mile will take place Friday, July 12, 2024 at 6:30 p.m. in Pittsburgh's North Shore neighborhood. The race begins at P3R's headquarters near Acrisure Stadium and finishes on West General Robinson Street. The event will conclude with the epic Mile 1.1 post-race party, offering participants, families and friends a chance to revel in their accomplishments while enjoying Pittsburgh's local hospitality and vibrant atmosphere. Race Info & Registration America's Mile is Pittsburgh's signature one-mile challenge event. Fourteen years in the making, America's Mile transcends the conventional race, turning every step into a narrative of personal triumph and communal celebration. Registration for America's Mile is available online The reimagined event will feature a variety of heats catering to different ages, abilities and competitive spirits, ensuring there's a place for everyone at the start line. Highlights include:The MOVE Mile: A welcoming race for participants of all abilities and aspirations.The Kids of STEEL Mile: A fun and encouraging race for children 13 and younger, alongside their guardians.The Heroes‚Äô Mile: A tribute heat for our nation's valiant servicemen and women.The Aspire Mile: A competitive challenge for adults aiming to surpass their personal bests. Additional heats include the Corporate Challenge Mile, the Masters Mile, the Unstoppable Mile, the RUN Varsity Mile, and the exclusive Elite Miles, alongside a Virtual Mile option for remote participants. The event will offer a prize purse of $34,200 with cash prizes for the top five runners in the Pro Mile, Unstoppable, Masters 40-49, Masters 50-59 and Masters 60+. Official Watch Party & Post-Race Celebration Whether you're running or supporting your friends and family, Mike's Beer Bar is the place to be for America's Mile! Mike's will be showing a livestream of the finish line and is located at the halfway point of the course, making it the perfect meetup and ultimate cheer zone for your group. Other festivities include:Giveaways & Prizes360-degree Photo BoothFood and drink specialsLive DJInflatables and GamesOne free Michelob Ultra beer for finishers 21+ Plan Your Visit Make the most of your time during America's Mile by exploring Downtown Pittsburgh or other exciting Pittsburgh neighborhoods. Discover fun things to do throughout the city and be sure to experience our culinary scene before attending a performance.Visiting from out of town? Check out our guide to local hotels to find comfortable accommodations for every budget. Things to Do in Pittsburgh Events & Festivals ‚ÄãThere's always something happening in Pittsburgh. Learn More Tours & Sightseeing ‚ÄãHowever you like to roll, Pittsburgh is sure to have the sightseeing option for you. Learn More

Sign in Sign in with Facebook Sign in with a different account Answer security questions to recover your account √ó Manage cookies Your privacy Functional Performance & Analytics Targeting, Marketing & Social Media We value the trust that you place in Race Roster by sharing your personal data with us and we are committed to handling your personal data in a way that is fair and worthy of that trust. Therefore, please keep in mind that when you visit our site, we and third parties may store or retrieve information on your browser, mostly in the form of cookies. However, you can learn more about cookies and exercise choice regarding non-essential cookies by navigating the sections above. We encourage you to click on the different sections above to access a description of each category and to choose your settings for our site. Your settings do not automatically apply to all Race Roster sites you visit, and you must set your choices on each browser and device you use. If you block or clear cookies on your device you may lose your Race Roster settings. For more information, including other ways to control cookies, please also read our Privacy Policy and Cookie Policy. These cookies are necessary for the website to function properly and are therefore set to "always active". They are often set in response to actions made by you which amount to a request for services, such as setting your (privacy) preferences, remembering items in your shopping cart, logging in or completing forms. You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the website will not then work. These cookies allow us to measure and analyze our website audience so we can improve the performance of our sites. They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the website. They also allow us to improve the speed with which we can process your request, allowing us to remember the website preferences you have selected. It also helps identify issues faced by users on the website. Not allowing these cookies may result in poorly-tailored recommendations and slow site preferences. Activate analytical cookies These cookies allow us to make your user experience more personal and to recommend certain products. We do this, among other things, based on your behavior on the Race Roster website across the various devices you use. Furthermore, these cookies collect information to tailor advertising to your interest. They can be set by us or by our advertising partners. They may be used to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant advertising on our websites or on other websites. If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less targeted advertising. Social Media cookies offer the possibility to connect you to your social networks (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn) and share content from our website through social media. Activate marketing cookies More information Cancel Save & accept

content: Tekko 2024 in Pittsburgh, PA | Visit Pittsburgh Skip to content Newsletter Discover Your Persona 77¬∞F 0 Saved Navigation Things to DoFree Things to DoFamily FunTours & SightseeingOutdoor AdventureArts & CultureShoppingHealth & WellnessPittsburgh Sports TeamsCasinos & GamingFilm FestivalsEvents & FestivalsSubmit Your EventThis Week in PittsburghAnnual EventsHoliday EventsHalloween EventsFilm FestivalsFood FestivalsMarathons, Runs & WalksHotels & ResortsRestaurants & CulinaryBars & NightlifePittsburgh Craft BreweriesWineries & DistilleriesFarms & Farmers MarketsPlan Your TripPittsburgh Insiders GuideDiscounts and PassesBeyond PittsburghTransportationExplore Black Culture & HeritageLGBTQIA+ Travel in PittsburghPet-friendly TravelCollege VisitsSenior TravelMedical TravelAccessibility GuideWeatherWelcome CentersNewsletterNeighborhoodsMeetings and EventsMeet in PittsburghHotelsEvent ServicesMarketing ToolkitGroup TourSubmit RFPContact UsShow Your BadgeSportsPITTSBURGHAbout SportsPITTSBURGHSports Event PlannerSports FacilitiesCalendar of EventsSports Event AttendeePower of Sports Economy Weddings & ReunionsMediaPartners Discover Your Persona Tekko Explore the annual Tekko in downtown Pittsburgh, finding information about tickets, activities, and more. Credit |@axira11250 Make your way to Pennsylvania‚Äôs biggest anime convention and delve into the various realms of Japanese pop culture in downtown Pittsburgh. Uniting thousands of fans from around the globe, Tekko is a multi-day celebration that ensures unforgettable experiences for all visitors. Cosplay, special guests, and arcade games are just some of the highlights at this one-of-a-kind event. MORE EVENT INFORMATION When & Where Tekko will run from July 18 to 21, 2024 at the David L. Lawrence Convention Center, which is located at 1000 Fort Duquesne Boulevard. Parking David L. Lawrence Convention Center offers a spacious parking garage on 10th Street with rates ranging from $8 to $30. There are also three bike rack stations in the garage, which are situated on level one and the northside exterior by Fort Duquesne Boulevard. TIP: Interested in exploring more of the downtown area after Tekko? Look through the official website of ParkPGH and find real-time parking availability. View this post on Instagram A post shared by Tekko (@teamtekko) Admission General Admission - $70Premium - $150Rockstar - $300Children (between the ages of seven to 12) - $30Children (six years of age and under) - Free Admission features will vary depending on the type of ticket purchased. For more details, register for Tekko here. View this post on Instagram A post shared by Tekko (@teamtekko) Featured Experiences Guest Appearances Don‚Äôt miss the opportunity to meet the talented actors from iconic anime shows such as Attack on Titan, Hunter x Hunter, and Demon Slayer. English dub fans will be enthralled recognizing familiar voices across the latest anime hits and old classics. Educational Panels & Workshops Transport yourself to the other side of the world with the Tekko Gakkou‚Äìan educational program that is centered around Japanese culture. Attending this event with the little ones? Chibi Tekko has got families covered with interactive arts and crafts. Local Vendors Shop ‚Äòtil you drop at Tekko‚Äôs flea market, discovering a treasure trove of anime memorabilia and manga. Peruse through an array of comic books, card games, and props. Cosplay Activities Capture your memories at Tekko with different cosplay guests and watch the thrilling Craftsmanship Contest, marveling at a series of handmade costumes. Additional cosplay events include a performance contest and an Iron Cosplay activity, which involves making clothes from garbage. Live Entertainment & Games Groove to high-energy beats from live DJs at the dance party, or step on the Stage Uzume, showcasing your talented choreography or vocals to other fellow fans. From an Idolfest to Kpop covers, there is no shortage of musical events at Tekko. Elevate your experience with plenty of arcade-, role-playing-, board-, and collectible card games. Where to Stay Credit |@pepinoreno on Instagram Downtown Pittsburgh offers a variety of premier-rated accommodations with affordable prices and comfortable amenities. Whether you‚Äôre looking for pet-friendly services or a state-of-the-art fitness center, the downtown area is brimming with exceptional hotels. Explore More Best Comic Book Shops in Pittsburgh Crash! Bang! Zoom into these local shops Details Japanese Restaurants in Pittsburgh Enjoy a variety of Japanese restaurants in Pittsburgh, indulging in traditional flavors, modern twists, and a blend of different cuisines. title: Tekko | Registration
content: Tekko | Registration REGISTER NOW Jul 17 - 20 2025 MENU Registration Badge Information **ALL SALES ARE FINAL** General Admission Click here to register now!Premium Click here to register now!Rockstar Click here to register now!Show General Admission Information Overview Enjoy Tekko all three days and the Thursday preview night Super Early Bird Rate $55 until July 31st, 2024 Early Bird Rate $60 until January 31st, 2025 Regular Rate $65 until May 31st, 2025 At-Door Rate $70 from June 1st, 2025 all the way through Tekko 2025 Click Here To Register **All Sales Are Final** Show Premium Admission Information Overview Enjoy all the benefits of General Admission and get more out of Tekko with access to VIP lines, autograph sessions, guest panels, exclusive swag, & More Regular Rate $150 750 are available while supplies last Click Here To Register **All Sales Are Final** More Information Premium Badges offer a VIP Tekko Experience! Click Here To Register Exclusive Badge Pickup Line With almost 10,000 people in attendance last year and hopefully even more this year, the Registration hall can get crowded. Using the VIP Pickup line will help get you through Registration faster so you have more time to enjoy everything to do at Tekko Exclusive Main Stage Entry Line Using the VIP Entry line means you can spend less time waiting and more time doing. Main Stage seats are ‚Äòfirst come first served‚Äô so beating the crowds means you can settle into the best seat in the house Early Expo Hall Access Our Expo Hall is jam packed with vendors, artists, community partners, autograph signing booths, and more. One hour of exclusive VIP access is available Friday, Saturday, and Sunday morning allowing you to take your time shopping or getting autographs* from our guests before the hall starts filling up. *Guest Autographs, photos, meet & greets, etc. will have an additional cost determined by each guest ** Subject to guest availability Premium Swag Bag Exclusive Tekko 2025 goodies including at least one piece of Tekko swag that‚Äôs not available for sale! This varies by year but some examples of previous items include a portable phone battery, a travel speaker, a refillable water/soda bottle, Sunglasses, etc. Unlimited Bag Check Walking the convention floor can be exhausting so take a load off! Our Bag Check allows you to drop off your bag, props, or cool new swag from the Expo Hall so you don‚Äôt need to lug it around all day.* You can drop off and pick up your stuff as many times as you would like throughout the weekend. *Items cannot be left overnight and must be picked up before the show floor closes each night. Commemorative General T-Shirt Pick up a commemorative Tekko 2025 General T-Shirt with your Premium or Rockstar badge! Be sure to check our social media for this year's design! Exclusive Autograph Line Be sure to grab an autograph from your favorite Voice Actors in the Expo Hall! All Voice Actors will have a priority line for all Premium and Rockstar badge holders. *Guest Autographs, photos, meet & greets, etc. will have an additional cost determined by each guest ** Subject to guest availability Show Rockstar Admission Information Overview Elevate your Tekko experience with all the benefits of Premium Admission plus badges are mailed in advance so skip the registration line, ‚Äòno line‚Äô access to the Saturday night Concert, admission to our Sunday night Wrap Up Party & Private concert with the musical guests, exclusive swag, & More Regular Rate $300 An extremely limited quantity is available while supplies last Click Here To Register **All Sales Are Final** More Information Experience Tekko like a Rockstar! Click Here To Register Premium Perks Rockstars enjoy all of the perks of the Premium Badge plus much more Sunday Night Wrap Up Party & Private Concert The granddaddy of them all‚Ä¶ As Tekko winds down, close out the show with a bang. Your Rockstar badge is your ticket to a private party featuring our musical guests. Enjoy dinner and a drink* with your fellow Rockstars and Tekko Volunteers while experiencing a private concert performance in a laid back atmosphere. Our guests often choose to close out the performance with an exclusive autograph signing. *One drink ticket per person good for beer, wine, cocktail, or soft drink. Must be 21+ to order alcoholic beverages Badges Mailed to your Home All badges purchased before June 1st, 2025 will be mailed straight to you! That means you don‚Äôt need to go through the Registration Hall when you get to Tekko you can walk right in and start enjoying the show. Thursday Night Rockstar Meet-up Meet, mix, and mingle with other Rockstars, pick up any pre-order items, get your exclusive swag bag, get answers to all your burning Rockstar questions, and let us know how we can help you make your Tekko experience amazing. With this and the badge mailing you can skip all the lines and breeze into the convention without a care in the world. ‚ÄúNo Line‚Äù Access to the Saturday Night Concert Want to cut the line? No need to wait in line at all. Rockstars can meet outside the Main Stage before the concert begins and be ushered into the room before the doors open. Exclusive Rockstar T-Shirt Our Featured Artists have been hard at work creating awesome designs for our Tekko 2025 merch but this Tee is not for sale. Be one of sixty people with this exclusive way to show your excitement for Tekko! Exclusive Metal Badge & Rockstar Lanyard A great badge needs a great lanyard to compliment it, plus we would hate for you to lose that awesome metal badge. Advance notification when Tekko 2026 Badges go on sale An extremely limited number of Rockstar badges are available and once they're gone, they're gone so keep an eye on your email so you can get yours before they sell out. Register View Prices & Benefits Ticket Options for Tekko General $65 Premium $150 Rockstar $300 Access to all three days of Tekko and preview night on Thursday! Access to all three days of Tekko and preview night on Thursday! yes yes yesAccess to exclusive line for badge pickup Access to exclusive line for badge pickup no yes yesAccess to exclusive line for Main Stage events Access to exclusive line for Main Stage events no yes yesOne Hour exclusive access to Expo Hall Friday, Saturday, and Sunday morning One Hour exclusive access to Expo Hall Friday, Saturday, and Sunday morning no yes yesUnlimited use of Bag Check for Tekko 2025 Unlimited use of Bag Check for Tekko 2025 no yes yesTekko 2025 Swag Bag Tekko 2025 Swag Bag no yes yesCommemorative Tekko 2025 General T-Shirt Commemorative Tekko 2025 General T-Shirt no yes yesAccess to exclusive line for guest autographs Access to exclusive line for guest autographs no yes yesInvitation to the Tekko 2025 Sunday Night Wrap Up Party & private concert Invitation to the Tekko 2025 Sunday Night Wrap Up Party & private concert no no yesAccess to exclusive Thursday night Rockstar meetup Access to exclusive Thursday night Rockstar meetup no no yesExclusive ‚Äòno line‚Äô access to Saturday night Concert Exclusive ‚Äòno line‚Äô access to Saturday night Concert no no yesBadges mailed directly to your home (if purchased before June 1, 2025) Badges mailed directly to your home (if purchased before June 1, 2025) no no yesExclusive commemorative Rockstar Lanyard Exclusive commemorative Rockstar Lanyard no no yesExclusive commemorative Rockstar T-Shirt Exclusive commemorative Rockstar T-Shirt no no yesExclusive commemorative metal Rockstar Badge Exclusive commemorative metal Rockstar Badge no no yesReceive advance notification when Tekko 2026 Rockstar Badges go on sale Receive advance notification when Tekko 2026 Rockstar Badges go on sale no no yes** If purchased before June 1st 2024 ** If purchased before June 1st 2024 no no no Choose your badge(s) on the following page! Purchase Now! **ALL SALES ARE FINAL THERE ARE NO REFUNDS** Registration Hours Please refer to our hours of operation page to view our registration hours and how they compare to the rest of the schedule. Children's Admission Children ages 7-12: $30 Children 6 and under: Free **Available at-door only** Sunday Discount General Admission: $35 Tekko does not offer single day badges however half price General Admission badges are available on Sunday while supplies last. Registration FAQ My ticket was never emailed to me! What now? Don't panic! We have your ticket and you will not be prevented from attending Tekko. :) All you have to do is log into your eventeny account, here is a handy guide: https://help.eventeny.com/hc/en-us/articles/7267320496155-How-do-I-access-my-previously-purchased-tickets- What if I need a refund? Unfortunately, Tekko has a no refund policy for all badge purchases and all sales are final. However, if you are unable to attend Tekko due to unforeseen circumstances, you can transfer your badge to someone else prior to picking it up. You can find out more on Eventeny at https://help.eventeny.com/hc/en-us/articles/8386005430555-Editing-Tickets-After-Checkout Can I transfer my registration/badge to Tekko 2024 or another event? No, registrations for Tekko 2025 are only valid for Tekko 2025 and cannot be transferred to another event however you can transfer to another person. You can find out how on Eventeny at https://help.eventeny.com/hc/en-us/articles/8386005430555-Editing-Tickets-After-Checkout Are single day badges available? No, Tekko does not offer single day however half price General Admission badges are available on Sunday while supplies last What is Unlimited Bag Check? During Tekko there will be a designated area for people to drop off their bags and other personal items for temporary storage throughout the day while you are enjoying the convention. By purchasing Unlimited Bag Check during registration you can make use of this throughout the weekend with no additional charge. Please note that unlimited bag check is already included with Premium and Rockstar badges. Can I purchase a Premium or Rock Star Badge at the door? A limited number of Premium and Rockstar Badges are sold and they are expected to sell out during pre-registration so we recommend that you pre-register if you would like a Premium or Rockstar badge. Can I buy Tekko Merchandise Items separately? Most items will be available for sale during Tekko at our Merch booth in the Expo Hall however some items will be available for pre-order only so if you see something you like pre-ordering when you purchase your badge is encouraged. Please note that the Rockstar T-Shirt is an exclusive perk for Rockstar Badge holders and will not be available for sale. Can I register more than one individual at a time? Yes! You may purchase up to ten tickets per transaction. If you are representing a group or organization of more than ten people, we recommend that you use Group Registration. Can I transfer my badge to someone else? Yes! All you have to do is log into your eventeny account, here is a handy guide: https://help.eventeny.com/hc/en-us/articles/8386005430555-How-to-Edit-Name-and-Email-on-Ticket-After-Purchase-On-Eventeny I have a new email address. Can I update the address linked to my Tekko registration? Yes! All you have to do is log into your eventeny account, here is a handy guide: https://help.eventeny.com/hc/en-us/articles/8386005430555-How-to-Edit-Name-and-Email-on-Ticket-After-Purchase-On-Eventeny Will my badge be mailed to me? Only Rockstar badges purchased before June 1st 2025 will be mailed to the address you provided during registration. If you have changed your address please update it before June 1st, 2025. All you have to do is log into your eventeny account, here is a handy guide: https://help.eventeny.com/hc/en-us/articles/8386005430555-How-to-Edit-Name-and-Email-on-Ticket-After-Purchase-On-Eventeny What should I bring to Tekko in order to pick up my badge? All you need to bring with you to Tekko to pick up your badge is your confirmation email! After you pre-register, you will receive a confirmation email with a QR code which will let our registration staff look up your information when you arrive. You can bring the email on your phone or print it out. If you are planning on attending any 18+ content at Tekko, remember to bring your photo ID as well. What if I have a question that was not answered here? Please reach out to us at registration@pittjcs.org for any additional questions related to Tekko Registration and we would be happy to assist you. We receive a high volume of emails (especially right before the event), so please be patient if we take a couple of days to get back to you. Group Registration Groups or organizations such as high school or college anime clubs, Boy Scouts, Girl Scouts, etc. can apply for a group registration to receive a discount! Our Group Registration will be available through Eventeny soon! If you have any questions please reach out to us at registration@pittjcs.org

title: Night in the Tropics: Island Oasis - National Aviary
content: Night in the Tropics: Island Oasis - National Aviary Night in the Tropics: Island Oasis Night in the Tropics: Island Oasis Night in the Tropics: Island Oasis Night in the Tropics: Island Oasis Thank you to Sponsors & Guests for a wonderful night! We hope you‚Äôll join us for 2025‚Äôs celebration; stay tuned for details. Click here to download photos from the evening, courtesy of Elliott Cramer! Spend the last July weekend on the North Shore! Journey to an Island Oasis on Fri., July 26, 2024 during the National Aviary‚Äôs hottest party: Night in the Tropics Presented by UPMC Health Plan! Step under the papel picado and transport yourself to a tropical celebration with show-stopping live entertainment, delicious signature island cocktails, and a spread of mouth-watering bites from more than a dozen (and counting!) local restaurants. Upgrade for a first-class VIP experience including early party access, FREE valet parking, exclusive Ambassador Animals and National Aviary experiences, full bar services with premium spirits, and more! All guests are able to explore habitats full of lush greenery after dark, where beautiful birds fly overhead and roost in tree canopies. Stay tuned for details on up-to-the-minute live entertainment, Silent Auction and raffle prizes, and delectable restaurant additions for this top-shelf event! This event supports the National Aviary‚Äôs avian care and conservation! Let Us Entertain You: It‚Äôs going to be a fiesta! Go on the ultimate Island Oasis adventure with entertainment that will blow your mind: No Bad JuJu Mariachi by Miguel Guaracha Music by Elias Khouri Dance Lessons with Marlon Silva Steel Drums by Dan Meunier LIVE mural painting by Maria DeSimone Prascak of Maria‚Äôs Ideas Drink, Dine, and UnWIND: All guests will enjoy delectable food, signature cocktails, wine, and beer. Angkor Restaurant Atria‚Äôs Specialty Catering Bistro To Go Betsy Ann Chocolates Braddock‚Äôs Rebellion Breadworks Eat‚Äôn Park Gianna Via‚Äôs Restaurant and Bar Graeters Ice Cream Il Pizzaiolo Industry Public House Juniper Grill Moe‚Äôs Southwest Grill My Favorite Sweet Shoppe Piada Italian Street Food Pittsburgh Barbecue Company Potomac Bakery Press House Coffee Sarris Candies The Porch Two Ugly Mugs Salsa Vallozzi Pittsburgh 5 Generations Bakers Beer provided by Frank Fuhrer Wholesale Co. Night in the Tropics: Island Oasis Passport This year‚Äôs signature cocktails are not only tasty; they‚Äôre your flight path around this 21+ party, courtesy of the Pittsburgh International Airport! Tropical destinations require a passport! At every Night in the Tropics bar, you‚Äôll find a signature cocktail linked to an airline, a stop, and of course, a popular drink found there. Northern Lights: Fly nonstop to Reykjavik, Iceland, on Icelandair from Pittsburgh through October 27! A 5.5-hour flight will take you to the majestic landscapes and breathtaking nature of Iceland ‚Äì book now at icelandair.com. Pennsylvania Punch: Fly ‚Äì don‚Äôt drive ‚Äì to Philadelphia! Frontier Airlines now offers 2x daily nonstop flights between Pittsburgh and Philly. Take in the Philly art museum, Independence Hall, or grab some cheesesteaks! More at flyfrontier.com. Cosmopolitan: New York City is expensive ‚Äì but your flight doesn‚Äôt have to be! Fly nonstop to New York‚Äôs LaGuardia Airport on Spirit Airlines ‚Äì and be in downtown Manhattan in 45 minutes! Want the chance to win a flight? Stamp your passport one signature drink at a time! Drawing has now closed; congratulations to the winners! After collecting all three passport stamps, you may drop your passport off at the Silent Auction area by 9 pm for a chance to win flight vouchers courtesy of Frontier Airlines! Winner must be 21 years or older. Not interested in sampling a signature cocktail, but want to enter the drawing? No worries! Simply travel to each bar and ask the bartender to stamp your passport. Remember: Upgrade to VIP for Even More Amazing Perks: Early access to the party Full bar service with premium spirits Up-close experiences with National Aviary Ambassador Animals FREE valet parking Pro tip: Bring cash to purchase raffle tickets to win a trip for two to Maui, sponsored by AAA Travel! Tickets are one for $10 or three for $25; learn more below! Silent Auction: Bidding has closed. Thank you to all bidders and congratulations to each and every winner! Get a chance to win amazing auction items while you‚Äôre at the party, or from the comfort of home during the Night in the Tropics Silent Auction. Bid on prizes including: Show you‚Äôre the ultimate football (and movie) fan by snagging an autographed, framed Rudy Ruettiger jersey ‚Äì complete with a mini LED screen that shows highlights from the classic film, ‚ÄúRudy!‚Äù Win autographed, framed sports memorabilia packages, perfect decorations for your home‚Äôs rec room! ‚ÄúGet outta ‚Äòtahn‚Äù with the family during a weekend Erie trip that takes care of everything: tickets to the Erie Zoo, expERIEnce Children‚Äôs Museum, a one-night stay at the Sheraton Erie Bayfront Hotel, gift cards to Sara‚Äôs Restaurant & Ice Cream Pub and for fuel! Plenty of summer fun featuring Aviary must-haves and must-dos, Kennywood tickets, Sandcastle tickets, golf outings, museum trips, and more! View Auction Items Enjoy the convenience of bidding on your favorite items from your phone by texting tropics2024 to 843-606-5995. Don‚Äôt worry about having to say near the prize(s) you‚Äôve been coveting: the auction app will send you a text if you‚Äôve been outbid. Stay tuned for new prizes added weekly! Raffle: Raffle now closed; congratulations to the winner! Enjoy an island oasis getaway for two to Maui, sponsored by AAA Travel! The prize includes round-trip economy airfare from any United States city to Maui, Hawaii, and six nights hotel accommodations. Purchase tickets at the National Aviary! Call 412-258-9465 or email [email protected] with any questions. Attire: Dress in your best tropical attire for this indoor/outdoor party! Bright colors are encouraged; leave your black tie outfits at home! Let loose with your best beachy sundress, or island-inspired ensemble. Comfortable shoes are recommended. Parking: VIP guests will arrive in style with FREE valet parking! Head to VIP check-in located at the National Aviary entrance at 700 Arch Street. General Admission ticket holders have the option to add on valet parking for $35. Convenient parking is available at Nova Place for $20, or for just $15 more, you can add valet parking to your General Admission Night in the Tropics ticket! Nova Place is located at 100 South Commons, Pittsburgh, PA 15212. ADA-accessible drop-off will be available at the entrance of the National Aviary. Please note: The Rivers Casino Shuttle is not available this year. Need a Ride? Consider contacting the following local rideshare services: Uber Lyft zTrip Please drink responsibly. Proceeds from this 21+ event benefit the National Aviary‚Äôs work to save birds and protect their habitats. Thank You to Our Sponsors! Presenting Sponsor Diamond Sponsors Platinum Sponsors Gold Sponsors Federated Investors Foundation, Inc. Silver Sponsors BranchPatternBuchanan Ingersoll & Rooney PCCintasCJL Engineering Fairfield LandscapingThe Gateway Engineers, Inc.Harmelin MediaHBK CPAs & ConsultantsJones DayKoppers Inc.Maher DuesselMcKamish, Inc.Oxford Development CompanyPriory Hospitality GroupRivers Veterinary Urgent CareTrust-Franklin Press Co. Raffle Sponsor Printing Partner Printscape Imaging & Graphics By purchasing Night in the Tropics tickets and completing our Signature Cocktails Passport, you are giving the National Aviary permission to send you emails. The National Aviary Has New Animal Ambassadors | Pittsburgh Magazine Guests can see Gouda daily at 3:15 p.m., except when the Aviary is closed on Tuesdays, for the skunk painting encounter. Read More ¬ª National Aviary welcomes 2 African penguin chicks | KDKA News WATCH NOW: The National Aviary is welcoming two new adorable African penguin chicks. Read More ¬ª 2 African penguin chicks hatch at National Aviary | KDKA News The aviary says the first chick hatched on Feb. 7 and weighed 60.5 grams, which is about as much as the standard pack of gum. The younger sibling hatched a few days later on Feb. 10, weighing around 55 grams. Read More ¬ª Welcome! National Aviary welcomes two baby chicks | Audacy The National Aviary on Pittsburgh‚Äôs North Side is ‚Äúoverjoyed‚Äù to welcome the arrival of two baby penguins. Read More ¬ª

title: Rock, Reggae & Relief Festival 2024 | Visit Pittsburgh
content: Rock, Reggae & Relief Festival 2024 | Visit Pittsburgh Skip to content Newsletter Discover Your Persona 77¬∞F 0 Saved Navigation Things to DoFree Things to DoFamily FunTours & SightseeingOutdoor AdventureArts & CultureShoppingHealth & WellnessPittsburgh Sports TeamsCasinos & GamingFilm FestivalsEvents & FestivalsSubmit Your EventThis Week in PittsburghAnnual EventsHoliday EventsHalloween EventsFilm FestivalsFood FestivalsMarathons, Runs & WalksHotels & ResortsRestaurants & CulinaryBars & NightlifePittsburgh Craft BreweriesWineries & DistilleriesFarms & Farmers MarketsPlan Your TripPittsburgh Insiders GuideDiscounts and PassesBeyond PittsburghTransportationExplore Black Culture & HeritageLGBTQIA+ Travel in PittsburghPet-friendly TravelCollege VisitsSenior TravelMedical TravelAccessibility GuideWeatherWelcome CentersNewsletterNeighborhoodsMeetings and EventsMeet in PittsburghHotelsEvent ServicesMarketing ToolkitGroup TourSubmit RFPContact UsShow Your BadgeSportsPITTSBURGHAbout SportsPITTSBURGHSports Event PlannerSports FacilitiesCalendar of EventsSports Event AttendeePower of Sports Economy Weddings & ReunionsMediaPartners Discover Your Persona Rock, Reggae & Relief Get ready for a summer of rhythm and goodwill with Pittsburgh's Rock, Reggae and Relief festival! This multi-event celebration, anchored by the main festival on August 10th at Stage AE, combines world-class music with community support. Hosted by the Piatt Family Foundation, the series includes free pop-up concerts in June and July, and a kick off party culminating in the main event. This year‚Äôs beneficiary is Pittsburgh Scholar House ‚Äì empowering single parents to pursue higher education and create better futures for their families. Join us for a season of beats, unity, and positive change in the heart of Pittsburgh! Rock, Reggae & Relief Event Details The Rock, Reggae & Relief Festival is on Saturday, August 10, 2024 at Stage AE on North Shore Drive between Acrisure Stadium and the Museum of Illusions in North Shore. Tickets The festival features three different admission options including general, VIP, and a Luxury Box for a group of four. To find more details and to secure your tickets, visit the Rock, Reggae & Relief Festival website. Lineup Dirty HeadsThe MovementThe ElovatersThird WorldRoots of CreationFubar Rock, Reggae & Relief Kick Off Party Start your festival experience on Friday, August 9, 2024, at Revel in Downtown Pittsburgh. Roots of Creation will deliver two FREE sets: one of their original music and another titled "Grateful Dub," a reggae-infused tribute to the Grateful Dead. Local Roots Summer Reggae Pop-Up Series The Local Roots Summer Reggae Pop-up Series brings the island vibes to Revel with two free concerts on June 7 and July 12, 2024. Enjoy local reggae acts alongside reggae-inspired food, specialty drinks, and rum tastings. Plan Your Trip Several hotels are conveniently located near the festival venue for out-of-town attendees. Nearby options include the Hyatt Place Pittsburgh - North Shore, The Landing Hotel, and Residence Inn by Marriott. If you‚Äôre looking for even more options, check out our hotels page to find comfortable accommodations for every budget. North Shore & North Side ‚ÄãAlong the Allegheny and Ohio Rivers, the North Shore boasts great views of Downtown. title: Pittsburgh Scholar House - Transformed by Education
content: Pittsburgh Scholar House - Transformed by Education Skip to main content Pittsburgh Scholar House Menu Close Pittsburgh Scholar House Improving the quality of life for single parents and their children through post-secondary education and comprehensive supportive services. The Wayfinders Program The Pittsburgh Scholar House is a newly launched nonprofit affiliate of the Family Scholar House, dedicated to using two-generation strategies to disrupt the cycle of poverty by enabling post-secondary educational attainment and comprehensive support services to improve quality of life for income eligible single parents and their children. What We Do Pittsburgh Scholar House offers educational, motivational, and family-centered support for single parents seeking a college degree while raising their children. We position families to achieve their educational goals, access employment opportunities in high-growth industries, and develop the knowledge and skills needed to maintain physical, mental, and financial well-being. Learn More About Us Pittsburgh Scholar House is a social impact organization composed of a community of experts with both the lived and technical experience needed to help single parents provide economic security for their children. Our partners have extensive experience in human services, community and economic development, higher education, early childhood learning, and philanthropy, which allows Pittsburgh Scholar House to empower families as they increase their economic mobility and improve their quality of life. Learn More Our Funders Pittsburgh Scholar House‚Äôs work is made possible through the generosity of our funders: birminghambuhlcaelcitizensedenfirst natheinzhillmanmcauleyopportunitypgh foundpenguinspncpnc charrkmsegalunited wayupmcura News View all Published Date: March 12, 2025 Piatt Family Foundation Presents $25,000 to PSH through Rock, Reggae & Relief Published Date: February 25, 2025 Pittsburgh Scholar House Board of Directors Announces CEO Dr. Diamonte Walker‚Äôs Departure Published Date: February 10, 2025 Celebrating the Heart of Black Women ‚Äì February 15

title: Guide to the Pittsburgh's Little Italy Days | Visit Pittsburgh
content: Guide to the Pittsburgh's Little Italy Days | Visit Pittsburgh Skip to content Newsletter Discover Your Persona 77¬∞F 0 Saved Navigation Things to DoFree Things to DoFamily FunTours & SightseeingOutdoor AdventureArts & CultureShoppingHealth & WellnessPittsburgh Sports TeamsCasinos & GamingFilm FestivalsEvents & FestivalsSubmit Your EventThis Week in PittsburghAnnual EventsHoliday EventsHalloween EventsFilm FestivalsFood FestivalsMarathons, Runs & WalksHotels & ResortsRestaurants & CulinaryBars & NightlifePittsburgh Craft BreweriesWineries & DistilleriesFarms & Farmers MarketsPlan Your TripPittsburgh Insiders GuideDiscounts and PassesBeyond PittsburghTransportationExplore Black Culture & HeritageLGBTQIA+ Travel in PittsburghPet-friendly TravelCollege VisitsSenior TravelMedical TravelAccessibility GuideWeatherWelcome CentersNewsletterNeighborhoodsMeetings and EventsMeet in PittsburghHotelsEvent ServicesMarketing ToolkitGroup TourSubmit RFPContact UsShow Your BadgeSportsPITTSBURGHAbout SportsPITTSBURGHSports Event PlannerSports FacilitiesCalendar of EventsSports Event AttendeePower of Sports Economy Weddings & ReunionsMediaPartners Discover Your Persona Little Italy Days Everyone's Italian for a weekend at this free, four-day festival in Bloomfield Since 2002, Little Italy Days has been the go-to cultural festival in the Bloomfield neighborhood of Pittsburgh. This block party/neighborhood celebration/food festival is so popular the streets are shut down, stages set up and vendors line everywhere you go featuring local businesses, authentic Italian-American cuisine and much more. Pictured |Did someone say ravioliCredit |@regnefeats on Instagram Follow our guide to this year's Pittsburgh Little Italy Days festival and we'll make you an honorary Italian as you shop local, play bocce and eat as many ravioli as you can. When & Where Pittsburgh's Little Italy Days will take place Aug. 15-18, 2024 on Liberty Ave. in Bloomfield from Ella St. to Gross St. Admission Little Italy Days is completely free to attend! Parking & Accessibility Free parking and a shuttle service is available at the UPMC Luna Garage on Saturday and Sunday. Free parking is also available at the parking garage at Liberty & Aspen. Five bus routes also run through Bloomfield, making it easy to leave the car and ride straight to the festival. This festival occurs outdoors on mostly flat streets and sidewalks throughout the Bloomfield neighborhood, and can easily be enjoyed by anyone with accessibility needs. Service dogs are also permitted. Credit |@catladycam on Instagram 2024 Entertainment Schedule The lively, free entertainment is one of the top reasons crowds love returning to Little Italy Days year after year. From strolling accordionists to liven your meal to a celebrity bocce tournament featuring beloved Pittsburgh personalities, this year's entertainment includes: Thursday, Aug. 15 6 p.m. - Celebrity Bocce Tournament Saturday, Aug. 17 Mini of Pittsburgh Stage at Cedarville & Liberty 2 p.m. Mirella the Musician - Authentic Italian Accordionist5:30 p.m. The Cavaliers - Playing Italian-American hits Froggy's Stage at Taylor & Liberty Noon - Untamed - All-female trio with excellent harmonies3 p.m. Pizza Acrobatics - 2x World Champion Matt Hickey of Caliente Pizza & Draft House4 p.m. The Nation's #1 Earth, Wind & Fire Tribute Band - Let's Groove Tonight7 p.m. Fleetwood Mac Tribute Band Silver Springs First Commonwealth Stage at Gross & Liberty Noon - Miss Little Italy Pageant2:30 p.m. Magic Moments - Pittsburgh's #1 Oldies Band Sunday, Aug. 18 Froggy's Stage at Taylor & Liberty Noon - Elias Khouri - Talented young singer and guitarist2:30 p.m. Jacksons Tribute Band Dancing Machine - Performing the music of Michael, Janet, and the Jackson 5 First Commonwealth Stage at Gross & Liberty Noon - East End Kids - Pittsburgh's premiere teen song & dance ensemble1:30 p.m. Mojo Hand - High-energy band with killer grooves Accordionist Hank Edwardo - strolling throughout the event Credit |@catladycam on Instagram Bocce & Beauty Pageants The food and the live music are reason enough to visit, but make sure your visit includes some of the other special events as well. The celebrity bocce challenge pits Irish against Italian with a ton of celebrity guests including athletes, politicians and media personalities as they vie for success on the bocce court with lots of laughs along the way. If you can't make that Thursday night, head to the bocce court Saturday or Sunday next to Pleasure Bar and catch the annual tournament in action. The Miss Little Italy pageant is always a blast for families to attend, too. With six age divisions, celebrate as contestants receive a crown, sash and flowers at noon on Saturday. Plan Your Visit Make the most of your time at the Little Italy Days by exploring all of Bloomfield during your visit. Then, discover fun things to do throughout the city and be sure to experience our culinary scene before attending a performance. Visiting from out of town? Check out our guide to local hotels to find comfortable accommodations for every budget. Outdoor Concerts) PIJF Jazz Train VIP Bundle Elevate your 15th Annual Pittsburgh International Jazz Festival, co-presented by Highmark Blue Cross Blue Shield, experience to the next level with the exclusive Jazz Train VIP Bundle. This all-in-one package includes your round-trip ticket aboard the iconic Jazz Train and VIP access to unforgettable experiences throughout the festival weekend. Acclaimed pianist Orrin Evans will return to host our third annual Jazz Train‚Ñ¢, departing for Pittsburgh on September 18 and returning on September 22. The reservation includes round-trip train tickets, live jazz performances onboard, gift bags, and light refreshments‚Äîall set against the backdrop of the scenic train journey. Participating Amtrak Stations: New York, Newark, and Philadelphia. The included VIP passes offer exclusive perks like priority seating for outdoor stages, access to the AWAACC building, VIP-only bars, lounge areas, and much more. This limited-time offer, in partnership with Amtrak, is sure to sell out quickly‚Äîdon‚Äôt miss your chance to be part of this unforgettable journey. Book your bundle today! content: The Pittsburgh Great Race 2025 | One GREAT Weekend ONE GREATWEEKEND September 27-28, 2025 ONE GREAT WEEKEND Registration Opens Soon! Race Results Volunteer Supporting Amyloidosis Research Each year The Great Race donates $1 from every Great Race and Dollar Bank Junior Great Race registration to the Richard S. Caliguiri Amyloidosis Fund, a fund held by the Pittsburgh Foundation that is dedicated to supporting medical research. Back again for 2024 -- $5 from every One GREAT Challenge registration will be donated. Learn More Dollar Bank Junior Great Race Enjoy fun and fitness during the 30th annual Dollar Bank Junior Great Race! Children can participate in the Family Fun Run, Tot Trot or Diaper Dash to earn their own medal and shirt. Learn More 48 Years and Still Running The annual Richard S. Caliguiri City of Pittsburgh Great Race started in 1977 when former Pittsburgh Mayor Richard S. Caliguiri established the race as a ‚Äúcommunity fun run.‚Äù Since that inaugural competition, nearly a half million people have participated in the Great Race, making the event the largest 10K race in Pennsylvania. Learn More Join us for Sunday's Awards Ceremony & Raffle! The Great Race concludes Sept. 29 festivities by honoring winners and awarding raffle prizes to runners/walkers! Learn More Our Sponsors

title: Kennywood Holiday Lights 2024 | Visit Pittsburgh
content: Kennywood Holiday Lights 2024 | Visit Pittsburgh Skip to content Newsletter Discover Your Persona 77¬∞F 0 Saved Navigation Things to DoFree Things to DoFamily FunTours & SightseeingOutdoor AdventureArts & CultureShoppingHealth & WellnessPittsburgh Sports TeamsCasinos & GamingFilm FestivalsEvents & FestivalsSubmit Your EventThis Week in PittsburghAnnual EventsHoliday EventsHalloween EventsFilm FestivalsFood FestivalsMarathons, Runs & WalksHotels & ResortsRestaurants & CulinaryBars & NightlifePittsburgh Craft BreweriesWineries & DistilleriesFarms & Farmers MarketsPlan Your TripPittsburgh Insiders GuideDiscounts and PassesBeyond PittsburghTransportationExplore Black Culture & HeritageLGBTQIA+ Travel in PittsburghPet-friendly TravelCollege VisitsSenior TravelMedical TravelAccessibility GuideWeatherWelcome CentersNewsletterNeighborhoodsMeetings and EventsMeet in PittsburghHotelsEvent ServicesMarketing ToolkitGroup TourSubmit RFPContact UsShow Your BadgeSportsPITTSBURGHAbout SportsPITTSBURGHSports Event PlannerSports FacilitiesCalendar of EventsSports Event AttendeePower of Sports Economy Weddings & ReunionsMediaPartners Discover Your Persona Kennywood Holiday Lights Explore an annual Pittsburgh tradition with sparkling lights and exciting rides. Every year, Kennywood showcases millions of festive lights and offers kid-friendly things to do for the holiday season. Credit |Jake Mysliwczyk via Kennywood Event Features Along with trails of sparkling lights, this event provides a variety of thrilling experiences for an action-packed day. Take family pictures with Santa, marvel at impressive model train displays, and discover an assortment of appetizing snacks. Family Attractions Step into a winter wonderland with a variety of kid-centered activities and rides. Zoom around a winding track at the Auto Race, or soar through the air against a backdrop of glimmering lights at the Merry-Go-Round station. The Kennywood Holiday Lights event offers a holiday spin on iconic attractions such as Noah‚Äôs Ark, Kiddieland, and Thomas Town Rides. Live Entertainment Make your way to the tree lighting ceremony, where the tallest tree in the state is lit with an assortment of decorations. Be immersed in a vibrant atmosphere with caroling from choir groups and readings from local celebrities. Food & Drinks Indulge in savory and sweet bites while having dinner with Santa, exploring a Christmas style buffet. Stroll through the amusement park and discover a variety of food stands with delectable snacks, including fried cheesecakes, s‚Äômores, and doughnuts. Unwind with a special drink at the beer garden area, or take in the aroma of sugar and spices at a concession spot like the Lagoon. Looking for more? Look through our guide on Kennywood‚Äôs food scene and find scrumptious meals for all palates. When & Where The Kennywood Holiday Lights will run from November 15, 2024 to January 1, 2025. Hours are generally Fridays from 5‚Äì9 p.m. and Saturdays and Sundays from 3‚Äì9 p.m., with additional dates around the holidays. This event is located at 4800 Kennywood Boulevard, West Mifflin, PA 15122. Admission Kennywood Holiday Lights tickets start at $19.99 per person with online orders. As for onsite tickets, general admission costs $39.99 per person, but children who are three years of age or younger can receive free entry. Visitors can purchase season passes for year-round free entry to the amusement park. Admission features and prices vary depending on the type of season package. With a plethora of winter attractions and festive treats, it‚Äôs easy to create a magical holiday outing at Kennywood. Kennywood Minutes from Downtown, Kennywood Park is one of Pittsburgh's best-loved historic landmarks. But don't let the history fool you! Three beloved, landmark wooden roller coasters are paired with Pennsylvania's fastest (Phantom's Revenge)‚Ä¶ Learn More Related Blog Posts Peoples Gas Holiday Market‚Ñ¢ Get into the holiday spirit at the 13th Annual Peoples Gas Holiday Market‚Ñ¢! Details Pittsburgh Holiday Lights Experience the sparkle this 2024 holiday season in Pittsburgh! Details Outdoor and Indoor Ice Rinks in Pittsburgh Glide and spin your way to these ice rinks across Pittsburgh Details Pittsburgh Holiday Pop-Up Bars It seems like pop-up bars just keep popping up! Let us help you find the most perfectly peculiar Pittsburgh pop-up‚Ä¶ Details GLOWLAND | Pittsburgh‚Äôs Premier Winter Lighting Festival Illuminating Oakland Nov. 22-Dec. 14 Details Dazzling Nights: A Night Time Garden Experience Pittsburgh Botanic Gardens welcomes guests of all ages with the return of Dazzling Nights for a second year. title: Pittsburgh Winter Beerfest 2025 | Visit Pittsburgh
content: Pittsburgh Winter Beerfest 2025 | Visit Pittsburgh Skip to content Newsletter Discover Your Persona 77¬∞F 0 Saved Navigation Things to DoFree Things to DoFamily FunTours & SightseeingOutdoor AdventureArts & CultureShoppingHealth & WellnessPittsburgh Sports TeamsCasinos & GamingFilm FestivalsEvents & FestivalsSubmit Your EventThis Week in PittsburghAnnual EventsHoliday EventsHalloween EventsFilm FestivalsFood FestivalsMarathons, Runs & WalksHotels & ResortsRestaurants & CulinaryBars & NightlifePittsburgh Craft BreweriesWineries & DistilleriesFarms & Farmers MarketsPlan Your TripPittsburgh Insiders GuideDiscounts and PassesBeyond PittsburghTransportationExplore Black Culture & HeritageLGBTQIA+ Travel in PittsburghPet-friendly TravelCollege VisitsSenior TravelMedical TravelAccessibility GuideWeatherWelcome CentersNewsletterNeighborhoodsMeetings and EventsMeet in PittsburghHotelsEvent ServicesMarketing ToolkitGroup TourSubmit RFPContact UsShow Your BadgeSportsPITTSBURGHAbout SportsPITTSBURGHSports Event PlannerSports FacilitiesCalendar of EventsSports Event AttendeePower of Sports Economy Weddings & ReunionsMediaPartners Discover Your Persona Pittsburgh Winter Beerfest Experience the annual Pittsburgh Winter Beerfest with our guide on the official dates, craft brew-filled activities, and more. Dates & Location Admission Featured Experiences Calling all beer lovers! Every year, the craft beer community comes together and celebrates the city's thriving brewery scene at the Pittsburgh Winter Beerfest. Sample over hundreds of local beers and other libations at this can‚Äôt-miss event, where expertly brewed IPAs, ales, stouts, and lagers await. Treat your tastebuds to bubbly glimpses of Pittsburgh‚Äôs thriving beer scene from local breweries and distilleries. Dates & Location Dates February 21 - 22, 2025 Location David L. Lawrence Convention Center | 1000 Fort Duquesne Boulevard View this post on Instagram A post shared by pittsburghbeerfest (@pittsburghbeerfest) Admission Early Admission: $60 - $75Regular Admission: $50 - $65Designated Driver: $30 - $40Connoisseur Reception: $100 - $125Connoisseur Designated Driver: $50 - $75 Know before you go: Event experiences will vary depending on your choice of tickets. General admission includes your selection of an event session, a 5oz beer mug, and sampling of more than 200 drinks. Purchase tickets on the official website of the Pittsburgh Beerfest here. Featured Experiences Local Beer Tastings - Sip on a variety of refreshing beers from local and regional breweries. Whether you‚Äôre an IPA enthusiast or a porter aficionado, there is no shortage of magnificent beers at this event. Explore the complete list of beers here. Live Entertainment - Groove to live music at the Pittsburgh Winter Beerfest, enjoying upbeat tunes and talented performers! There will also be plenty of dancing at the silent disco. Unforgettable Activities - Participate in exciting games in between beer tastings, including the Beerfest Claw Machine! View this post on Instagram A post shared by pittsburghbeerfest (@pittsburghbeerfest) Where to Stay After an action-packed day of beer tasting, why not unwind in a comfortable accommodation? Check into a top-tier stay in downtown Pittsburgh, relaxing in luxurious furnishings at budget-friendly prices. Enjoy close proximity to iconic attractions, flexible services, and modern amenities. Things to Do Before & After the Pittsburgh Winter Beerfest Expand your beer tasting experience with one-of-a-kind activities around Pittsburgh. Elevate your palate to new flavorsome heights by exploring exquisite culinary establishments in the downtown area, whether you‚Äôre craving fried chicken sandwiches or slices of wood-fired pizza. On February 22, don‚Äôt miss watching a thrilling game of hockey between the Pittsburgh Penguins and Washington Capitals at the PPG Paints Arena. Finally, plan a night of axe throwing at places like 2420 Penn, Full Throttle Adrenaline Park, and Paradise Island Bowl & Beach. Explore More 13 Awesome Pittsburgh Craft Breweries Discover top-rated Pittsburgh breweries, embarking on a craft beer-inspired exploration. Cultivate an unforgettable outing with Pittsburgh beer. Whether you‚Äôre a‚Ä¶ Details Craft Beer & Bites Beer to Pour & Menus to Explore Details Pittsburgh Craft Beer Winter Warmers Warm up with Pittsburgh's local craft brews Details Pittsburgh Craft Breweries Cheers to a city that is full of craft beer culture. Learn More

title: Annual Events in Pittsburgh, PA | 2025 Festivals & PGH Events | Visit Pittsburgh
content: Annual Events in Pittsburgh, PA | 2025 Festivals & PGH Events | Visit Pittsburgh Skip to content Newsletter Discover Your Persona 77¬∞F 0 Saved Navigation Things to DoFree Things to DoFamily FunTours & SightseeingOutdoor AdventureArts & CultureShoppingHealth & WellnessPittsburgh Sports TeamsCasinos & GamingFilm FestivalsEvents & FestivalsSubmit Your EventThis Week in PittsburghAnnual EventsHoliday EventsHalloween EventsFilm FestivalsFood FestivalsMarathons, Runs & WalksHotels & ResortsRestaurants & CulinaryBars & NightlifePittsburgh Craft BreweriesWineries & DistilleriesFarms & Farmers MarketsPlan Your TripPittsburgh Insiders GuideDiscounts and PassesBeyond PittsburghTransportationExplore Black Culture & HeritageLGBTQIA+ Travel in PittsburghPet-friendly TravelCollege VisitsSenior TravelMedical TravelAccessibility GuideWeatherWelcome CentersNewsletterNeighborhoodsMeetings and EventsMeet in PittsburghHotelsEvent ServicesMarketing ToolkitGroup TourSubmit RFPContact UsShow Your BadgeSportsPITTSBURGHAbout SportsPITTSBURGHSports Event PlannerSports FacilitiesCalendar of EventsSports Event AttendeePower of Sports Economy Weddings & ReunionsMediaPartners Discover Your Persona üìç Schenley Park Pittsburgh Vintage Grand Prix Annual Events The signature events that make Pittsburgh a destination every year Looking for something more specific? We also have lists of top beer festivals, music festivals, summer festivals, film festivals and fall festivals. Spring Events Summer Events Fall Events Winter Events Spring Events Pittsburgh Home & Garden Show For 10 days, explore more than 1,500 must-see exhibits, receive expert tips about home renovations and gardening, learn about the latest innovations in home technology, and find endless home inspiration, all in one place! Details St. Patrick's Day Parade Whether you're Irish or not, you'll want to join the fun in Downtown Pittsburgh. Get ready to pull out your green and celebrate Ireland's patron saint at one of the largest St. Patrick's Day Parades in the US. Details Pittsburgh Humanities Festival The Pittsburgh Humanities Festival investigates what makes us all human through a reimagined week of new ideas brought to light. Featuring interactive ASMR demos, talks with jazz legends, and a soul food culinary experience, all at the newly renovated Greer Cabaret Theater. Details Pittsburgh Fringe Spanning venues throughout the city, Pittsburgh Fringe is a performing arts festival featuring international, national and local artists and includes theater, comedy, visual arts, puppetry, music, opera, spoken word and much more. Details Art All Night This free, 22-hour long festival fills a gigantic warehouse location with art and performances from new and emerging artists. This inclusive and family-friendly event features live painting, interactive exhibits, films and 500+ participants. Details Dick's Sporting Goods Pittsburgh Marathon With more than 40,000 runners of all ages and abilities, Pittsburgh is excited to welcome back the Pittsburgh Marathon Weekend on May 4, 2025! This year's Race Weekend features the Marathon, Half Marathon, Marathon Relay, 5K, Kids Marathon, Toddler Trot and Pet Walk. Details Millvale Music Festival Voted the Best Music Fest of 2022 and 2023 by Pittsburgh City Paper, this free two-day festival features hundreds of bands at dozens of indoor and outdoor locations all throughout Millvale. Details EQT Children's Theater Festival This sprawling festival happens throughout Downtown Pittsburgh at theatres, parks, universities and other businesses as children exercise their creativity through live performances, scavenger hunts, brick building, STEM activities and much more. Most activities are free of charge! Details JFilm Enjoy great storytelling at the JFilm Festival! For 11 unforgettable days, Film Pittsburgh will transport you around the globe through a dazzling array of Jewish-themed independent cinema. Details Summer Events Pittsburgh Pride Kick off Pride month with a celebration in Pittsburgh! Pittsburgh Pride will feature performances, vendors, a community march, and free concerts featuring performances by local, national, and international artists. Details Dollar Bank Three Rivers Arts Festival The annual Dollar Bank Three Rivers Arts Festival is back! Featuring 400+ artists and musicians over 10 days, this Only In Pittsburgh festival is one of the best ways to start your summer. The best part? The Three Rivers Arts Festival is FREE! Details 3 Rivers Comicon 3 Rivers Comicon has been putting the comics back in comicon since 2016 with a huge focus on comics and their creators alongside engaging panels, amazing exhibitors, cosplay contests and more. Details Juneteenth Freedom Day This free, family-friendly event is a celebration of all Cities and Boroughs in Allegheny County and with three days of cultural activities, speakers, live music, a parade and local vendors! DOORS OPEN PITTSBURGH: Downtown Find out what you DON‚ÄôT know about Pittsburgh‚Äôs Downtown with DOORS OPEN Pittsburgh. Go behind-the-scenes and celebrate the architecture while inside a diverse collection of buildings ‚Äì sacred places, government offices, theaters, artists spaces and more! Details Anthrocon One of the largest anthropomorphics conventions in the world, this four-day celebration takes over the David L. Lawrence Convention Center and the Cultural District with the record-breaking Fursuit Parade and Block Party. Details City of Pittsburgh Fourth of July Celebration The City of Pittsburgh‚Äôs Independence Day celebration returns to the Point on July 4th! Enjoy a family-style picnic at historic Point State Park, complete with patriotic music and food vendors from 4 to 10 pm. Details America's Mile America's Mile is a spectacular race event open to all, set against Pittsburgh's breathtaking North Shore. Choose your challenge from diverse heats like the inclusive MOVE Mile, the brave Heroes' Mile, and the competitive Aspire Mile (just to name a few of your options!). Details Pittsburgh Vintage Grand Prix The Pittsburgh Vintage Grand Prix (PVGP) is the nation's largest vintage street race and the only one staged on public roads. It‚Äôs considered by drivers to be the most challenging racecourse worldwide with its tight turns, elevation changes and natural obstacles like stone walls, curbs, manhole covers and telephone poles. Details Northside Music Festival This free, three-day festival focuses on sharing great music across indoor and outdoor stages in Pittsburgh‚Äôs Northside. Additionally, you‚Äôll find family-friendly activities, food trucks and tons of surprises. Details Tekko Pittsburgh's premier Japanese pop culture convention returns to the David L. Lawrence Convention Center! Join fellow anime fans for a weekend full of fantastic guest meet-n-greets, cosplay competitions, games, J-rock concerts, pachinko and so much more. Details Picklesburgh A massive array of dill-ectable products and foods is central to all that is Picklesburgh, but the event also has a lot more options for pickle fanatics to experience, from dozens of live music performances to other popular activities like Pickle Cocktails, Pickle Beer, Pickle Juice Drinking Contest, and an abundance of pickle-themed apparel, merch, and much much more! Details Night in the Tropics: Island Oasis Spend the last July weekend on the North Shore! Journey to an Island Oasis during the National Aviary‚Äôs hottest party: Night in the Tropics! Step under the papel picado and transport yourself to a tropical celebration with show-stopping live entertainment, delicious signature island cocktails, and a spread of mouth-watering bites from more than a dozen (and counting!) local restaurants. Details Barrel and Flow Fest Barrel and Flow Fest, is the nation‚Äôs first Black beer festival and second best in the nation, according to USA Today. The annual event showcases the country‚Äôs most talented Black brewers, along with breweries from across the globe in collaboration with Black artists, entrepreneurs, politicians, and business owners. Details Rock, Reggae & Relief Rock Reggae & Relief is a benefit music festival that brings reggae tunes, unity and feel-good vibes to the heart of Downtown Pittsburgh while offering a helping hand to our neighbors in need. Details The Great American Banana Split Celebration Latrobe celebrates the birthplace of this all-American dessert with a weekend of live music, goat yoga, kids activities, Yellow Tie Gala, pie-eating contest, 5k banana run and so much more! This sweet treat festival has been a staple in Westmoreland County since 2013! Details Little Italy Days Everyone's Italian for a weekend at this free, four-day festival in Bloomfield featuring authentic Italian-American cuisine, live entertainment, and so much more. Details Pittsburgh Renaissance Festival Take a magical tour through time and legend at the Renaissance Festival. Purchase tickets, get a festival map and more at the Pittsburgh Renaissance Festival website. Details Pittsburgh Restaurant Week Held twice a year, in Summer and Winter, the annual Restaurant Week celebrations are the best time to discover the most delicious spots in Pittsburgh. Find dates, participating restaurants, maps and more. Details Soul Food Festival Savor a soulful taste of the Burgh at Pittsburgh‚Äôs can‚Äôt miss Soul Food Festival! Established in 2019, this festival honors Pittsburgh's rich history of food service pioneers and entrepreneurs with a weekend of live music, activities, and soul food from more than 100 vendors. Details Fall Events ReelAbilities Pittsburgh Film Festival The ReelAbilities Film Festival presents award-winning films through the lens of individuals living with disabilities. In addition to impactful films, the festival also features artwork and special guests to bring the themes of community and shared human experience to the forefront. ReelAbilities is a program of Film Pittsburgh. Details Pittsburgh Irish Festival Learn about the ethnic richness of the Irish and Irish-American culture at this three day festival. Enjoy Irish music on five stages. Find out more about the Festival on the official website. Details The Original Pittsburgh Taco Festival This special event has an incredible line up of 25+ of the best food vendors, and tons of live entertainment and family-friendly fun in the historic Strip District. Details Pittsburgh International Jazz Festival Don't miss this soulful weekend with more than 140 jazz musicians. Get information on free sessions, ticketed events. locations and more. Details Richard S. Caliguiri City of Pittsburgh Great Race The annual Richard S. Caliguiri City of Pittsburgh Great Race started in 1977, when former Pittsburgh Mayor Richard S. Caliguiri established the race as a ‚Äúcommunity fun run.‚Äù Since that inaugural competition, nearly a half million people have participated in the Great Race, making the event the largest 10K race in Pennsylvania. The popular fall fitness classic has expanded to include a 5K run/walk, a running clinic, the Junior Great Race, Great Race Expo and more. Details Reel Q Pittsburgh LGBTQ+ Film Festival The annual Reel Q film festival in October is the sixth oldest LGBTQ+ film festival in the world and the longest-running film festival in Pittsburgh. Reel Q spans 10 days with a variety of programs, panels, parties and community activities. The festival screens approximately 20 locally first-run feature films and 50+ short films spanning multiple genres. Details Winter Events Kennywood Holiday Lights Every year, Kennywood showcases millions of festive lights and offers kid-friendly things to do for the holiday season. Details Pittsburgh Restaurant Week Held twice a year, in Summer and Winter, the annual Restaurant Week celebrations are the best time to discover the most delicious spots in Pittsburgh. Find dates, participating restaurants, maps and more. Details Pittsburgh Winter Beerfest Experience the annual Pittsburgh Winter Beerfest with our guide on the official dates, craft brew-filled activities, and more. Details Explore More Only in Pittsburgh Events Only in Pittsburgh Summer Festivals & Events Learn More Pittsburgh Music Festivals To Jam To Learn More Top Beer Festivals in Pittsburgh Learn More Pittsburgh Fall Festivals 2024 Guide | Fairs, Events & More Learn More Pittsburgh Holiday Lights Learn More Film Festivals Learn More Marathons, Runs, Walks & Races Learn More Events & Festivals ‚ÄãThere's always something happening in Pittsburgh. Details Events This Week in Pittsburgh What's happening in Pittsburgh this week, you ask? Details

Details The Original Pittsburgh Taco Festival This special event has an incredible line up of 25+ of the best food vendors, and tons of live entertainment and family-friendly fun in the historic Strip District. Details Pittsburgh International Jazz Festival Don't miss this soulful weekend with more than 140 jazz musicians. Get information on free sessions, ticketed events. locations and more. Details Richard S. Caliguiri City of Pittsburgh Great Race The annual Richard S. Caliguiri City of Pittsburgh Great Race started in 1977, when former Pittsburgh Mayor Richard S. Caliguiri established the race as a ‚Äúcommunity fun run.‚Äù Since that inaugural competition, nearly a half million people have participated in the Great Race, making the event the largest 10K race in Pennsylvania. The popular fall fitness classic has expanded to include a 5K run/walk, a running clinic, the Junior Great Race, Great Race Expo and more. Details Reel Q Pittsburgh LGBTQ+ Film Festival The annual Reel Q film festival in October is the sixth oldest LGBTQ+ film festival in the world and the longest-running film festival in Pittsburgh. Reel Q spans 10 days with a variety of programs, panels, parties and community activities. The festival screens approximately 20 locally first-run feature films and 50+ short films spanning multiple genres. Details Winter Events Kennywood Holiday Lights Every year, Kennywood showcases millions of festive lights and offers kid-friendly things to do for the holiday season. Details Pittsburgh Restaurant Week Held twice a year, in Summer and Winter, the annual Restaurant Week celebrations are the best time to discover the most delicious spots in Pittsburgh. Find dates, participating restaurants, maps and more. Details Pittsburgh Winter Beerfest Experience the annual Pittsburgh Winter Beerfest with our guide on the official dates, craft brew-filled activities, and more. Details Explore More Only in Pittsburgh Events Only in Pittsburgh Summer Festivals & Events Learn More Pittsburgh Music Festivals To Jam To Learn More Top Beer Festivals in Pittsburgh Learn More Pittsburgh Fall Festivals 2024 Guide | Fairs, Events & More Learn More Pittsburgh Holiday Lights Learn More Film Festivals Learn More Marathons, Runs, Walks & Races Learn More Events & Festivals ‚ÄãThere's always something happening in Pittsburgh. Details Events This Week in Pittsburgh What's happening in Pittsburgh this week, you ask? Details
